1. **Added Next.js Image import** at the top
2. **Modified the heading section** to use a flex container with the image and text side by side

The code expects the image at `/medical-ghost.png` in the `public` folder. Please:

1. Save your ghost image file as `medical-ghost.png` in the `public` folder, or
2. If you have a different filename, let me know and I can update the code

The image will appear next to the heading with appropriate sizing (60x60 pixels) and spacing. The layout uses flexbox so the image and text align horizontally.

**To fix the display issue, you need to:**

1. Add your ghost icon image file to the `public` folder
2. Name it `medical-ghost.png` (or update the code if you use a different name)

The code is set to look for the image at `/medical-ghost.png` in the public folder. Once you add the file there, it should display next to "Buckeye Sighting Stats".

If your image has a different filename or format (like `.jpg` or `.svg`), tell me and I can update the code to match.
